t: Psalm 139
For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
You*pn have searched me, Lord,*s and*ld you know me.
You*ln know when I sit and when I rise; you*ld perceive my thoughts from afar.
You*ln discern my going out and my lying down; you*ld are familiar with all my ways.
Before*ln a word is on my tongue you,*ld Lord,*s know it completely.
You*ln hem me in behind and before, and*ld you lay your hand upon me.
Such*ln knowledge is too wonderful for me, too*ld lofty for me to attain.
Where*pn can I go from your Spirit? Where*ld can I flee from your presence?
If*ln I go up to the heavens, you are there; if*ld I make my bed in the depths, you are there.
If*ln I rise on the wings of the dawn, if*ld I settle on the far side of the sea,
even*ln there your hand will guide me, your*ld right hand will hold me fast.
If*ln I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me and*ld the light become night around me,”
even*ln the darkness will not be dark to you; the*ld night will shine like the day, for*ld darkness is as light to you.
For*pn you created my inmost being; you*ld knit me together in my mother’s womb.
I*ln praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your*ld works are wonderful, I*ld know that full well.
My*ln frame was not hidden from you when*ld I was made in the secret place, when*ld I was woven together in the depths of the earth.
Your*ln eyes saw my unformed body; all*ld the days ordained for me were written in your book before*ld one of them came to be.
How*ln precious to me are your thoughts, God! How*ld vast is the sum of them!
Were*ln I to count them, they*ld would outnumber the grains of sand— when*ld I awake, I am still with you.
If*pn only you, God, would slay the wicked! Away*ld from me, you who are bloodthirsty!
They*ln speak of you with evil intent; your*ld adversaries misuse your name.
Do*ln I not hate those who hate you, Lord,*s and*ld abhor those who are in rebellion against you?
I*ln have nothing but hatred for them; I*ld count them my enemies.
Search*ln me, God, and know my heart; test*ld me and know my anxious thoughts.
See*ln if there is any offensive way in me, and*ld lead me in the way everlasting.
